title: HTML Semantic Elements Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of semantic HTML and meaningful markup

questions.question: What's the main benefit of using semantic HTML?
choices: It makes the website load faster
It gives meaning to content, helping accessibility & SEO
It changes the color of elements
questions.explanation: Semantic HTML provides meaning to content, making it more accessible to screen readers and better understood by search engines.

questions.question: Which tag is used for the primary page content?
questions.explanation: <main> represents the dominant content of the document body, excluding headers, footers, and navigation.

questions.question: Which element should be unique (only one per page)?
questions.explanation: There should only be one <main> element per page as it represents the primary content area.

questions.question: What's the difference between <section> and <article>?
choices: <article> is a self-contained piece; <section> is for grouping content
questions.explanation: <article> represents standalone, self-contained content that could be distributed independently, while <section> is for grouping thematically related content.

questions.question: Which element is best for navigation menus?
questions.explanation: <nav> represents a section of navigation links, making it the semantic choice for menus and navigation areas.
